hobby.message: Urban exploration or just drinking underground?
Political literature still keeping you up?
Still folding origami to stay grounded?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me - In free time, I fold origami... from scrap forms mostly. It helps me think - quietly.
neutral_answer: Managed okay, yes. Avoided any large crowds—I prefer it that way.
I spend my free time quietly. Origami. Simple, straightforward.
Recent protests were... disruptive. Hard to focus.
I work with scrap paper—never waste a piece.
Just folding shapes, not a big deal.
Made it here smoothly, though. I tend to keep to myself.
Origami... folds help me keep my mind sharp.
Protests created distractions, but manageable.
Scare paper's best—keeps me resourceful.
I fold complex models, all from memory. Good exercise.
No trouble, really. Slight detour at most.
Origami's my go-to hobby. Intricate folds, very calming.
Protests shook things up a bit, interrupted my routine.
I use leftover paper—it’s my way to recycle.
Creating complex models from scratch is gratifying.
No issues getting here, thankfully. Just avoided the busy spots.
I’ve taken to origami. Love the precision and focus it demands.
Those protests had me distracted—my mind drifted from the paper folds.
Scrapping paper from work is oddly satisfying, keeps me thrifty.
Folding models from my imagination keeps me balanced.
Oh, no trouble at all. Just another day in Stenograd.
Origami’s my retreat—each fold is like a new thought, carefully placed.
The recent protests on the BCI mess had me fidgeting, got into my origami time.
Scraps from work are perfect; I feel like they have hidden stories.
Folding something intricate by heart, it’s relaxing... like sorting through life’s chaos.
hobby_answer: Yeah, origami, that's my thing.
Keeps my hands busy, mind a little less noisy.
Though, these protests got my fingers fidgety.
Hard to focus on folding paper lately.
Just hear things, see things, somehow, it stays in my head, you know?
Origami's been... well, you know, my go-to.
Funny how protests make me fold faster.
Rummaging paper more than usual these days.
Hard to shake off those Council debates.
Can't fold a proper crane with all this noise around.
Origami—my escape in paper form.
Protests made my favorite crane fold a bit sloppy.
Guess the system hiccups are creeping into my hobby too.
Suppose crafting a lotus petal mirrors my thought process now.
Lately, I've been folding to drown out the noise around here.
Origami's my balance beam amid chaos.
Those protests got me folding intricate pieces furiously.
Folded a dragon the other night, frustrations turned art.
They say folding inspires patience, but is patience enough now?
Between Council uproars and my papers, there's solace in each crease.
Origami's my sanctuary when work overwhelms.
Been folding since a kid, a quiet rebellion against noise.
Recent debates about the BCI got me folding faster, more passionately.
Dragon model the other night, inspired by resilience those protesters show.
I swear my cranes are listening, absorbing every protest echo.
